title: Trump-backed Republican Matt Van Epps wins US House special election in Tennessee
description: Republican Matt Van Epps won a nationally watched special election in Tennessee for a seat in the U.S. House on Tuesday, maintaining his party’s grip on the district with help from President Donald Trump.  A military veteran and former state general services commissioner from Nashville, Van Epps defeated Democratic state Rep. Aftyn Behn to represent the 7th Congressional District.

title: The defense secretary’s placard had an unfortunate misspelling.
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth drew ridicule for a disastrous typo on his namecard during Tuesday’s Cabinet meeting. Hegseth’s placard labeled his role in the administration as the “SSecretary of War” at the meeting, where he doubled down on his department’s deadly boat strikes in the Caribbean and vowed to put “narcoterrorists at the bottom of the ocean.” The typo was immediately mocked by critics, including California Gov. Gavin Newsom, who hinted at its disturbing similarity to the SS, the Nazi Germany paramilitary organization responsible for the genocide of roughly six million Jews during the Holocaust.

title: Minnesota state government employees say they wrote to Kamala Harris, DNC, 'warning' about Walz as VP pick
description: Minnesota state government employees claim they warned former Vice President Kamala Harris and the Democratic National Committee about Tim Walz's alleged "incompetence" and "fraud scandals."

title: Mass wedding in Gaza celebrates new life after years of war and tragedy
description: Eman Hassan Lawwa was dressed in traditional Palestinian prints and Hikmat Lawwa wore a suit as they walked hand-in-hand past the crumbled buildings of southern Gaza in a line of other couples dressed in exactly the same way.  The 27-year-old Palestinians were among 54 couples to get married Tuesday in a mass wedding in war-ravaged Gaza that represented a rare moment of hope after two years of devastation, death and conflict.  "Despite everything that has happened, we will begin a new life," Hikmat Lawwa said.

title: Former Trump lawyer Alina Habba is disqualified as top New Jersey prosecutor, US appeals court rules
description: President Donald Trump’s former personal lawyer Alina Habba is disqualified from serving as New Jersey’s top federal prosecutor despite his administration’s maneuvers to keep her in the role, an appeals court said Monday.  A panel of judges from the 3rd U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals sitting in Philadelphia sided with a lower-court judge's ruling after hearing oral arguments at which Habba was present on Oct. 20.

The Opportunity
The $6 trillion chemicals industry runs the physical economy but still relies on spreadsheets and legacy systems. It is responsible for 25 percent of global emissions and is one of the least digitized sectors in the world. AI can transform how this sector operates.
We are building the intelligence layer for the process industries. Our software understands workflows, reasons over data, and acts inside real operations from quote to shipment.

title: ‘The biggest decision yet’: Jared Kaplan on allowing AI to train itself
description:
Anthropic’s chief scientist says AI autonomy could spark a beneficial ‘intelligence explosion’ – or be the moment humans lose control
Humanity will have to decide by 2030 whether to take the “ultimate risk” of letting artificial intelligence systems train themselves to become more powerful, one of the world’s leading AI scientists has said.
Jared Kaplan, the chief scientist and co-owner of the $180bn (£135bn) US startup Anthropic, said a choice was looming about how much autonomy the systems should be given to evolve.
 Continue reading...

title: Charlie Kirk tops Wikipedia’s list of most-read articles in 2025
description:
Zohran Mamdani, Ozzy Osbourne and Sinners also feature in encyclopedia’s top 20 most-read English-language pages
Wikipedia’s article on Charlie Kirk was the most read on the online encyclopedia this year, as users sought out information on the conservative activist.
People viewed the entry on Kirk nearly 45m times, many after he was shot at a university campus debate on 10 September.
Charlie Kirk, 44.9m page views
Deaths in 2025, 42.5m
Ed Gein, 31.

title: Vladislav Gavrikov's OT goal lifts Rangers over Stars 3-2
description: NEW YORK (AP) — Vladislav Gavrikov scored just over a minute into overtime and the New York Rangers beat Dallas 3-2 on Tuesday night, ending the Stars' four-game winning streak.Gavrikov scored for the Rangers 1:09 into overtime on a backhand shot. Carson Soucy and Will Cuylle also scored for the Rangers, who have won four of their last five games. Artemi Panarin added two assist and Mika Zibanejad's assist on the overtime goal gave him two goals and three assists in his last four games.Cuylle’s third-period wrist shot tied the game with 2:13 left.

description: Larry Summers received a lifetime ban from the American Economic Association, citing his "conduct, as reflected in publicly reported communications."

title: I own over two dozen cashmere sweaters — here are 13 brands I recommend for their softness, durability, and chic designs
description: I tested cashmere sweaters ranging from affordable to luxury grade. I found that gauge and ply affects the yarn's quality more than the price tag.

title: Amazon is speeding up its delivery with a new ultrafast test that arrives in 30 minutes or less
description: Amazon says customers in certain markets can get thousands of essentials delivered in under 30 minutes. Walmart is also racing to speed up delivery.

title: Restaurant chain K&W Cafeteria abruptly closes all its locations after 88-year run
description: K&W Cafeteria, known for its affordable, homestyle meals like baked spaghetti, announced its permanent closure in a Facebook post.

title: Luigi Mangioni claimed he was a homeless man named 'Mark' in surreal, newly revealed bodycam footage of his arrest
description: Handcuffs and Christmas carols feature in police bodycam video of Luigi Mangione's arrest, revealed in court Tuesday for the first time.

title: Instagram's Adam Mosseri is getting rid of a part of work that many employees dread
description: As companies rethink corporate culture, Instagram chief Adam Mosseri is the latest to crack down on the dreaded recurring meeting.

title: A Koch-funded group is tapping star marketers for a $250 million push to 'reignite the American spirit'
description: The Koch-funded Stand Together is supporting a new effort that's lined up top marketers to boost civic engagement around America's 250th birthday.

title: Theragun's Mini Plus is our fitness expert's favorite recovery tool and just might be the only massage gun you ever need
description: The Theragun Mini Plus solves nearly all of the issues we have with other massage guns, and we love its built-in heat therapy.

title: Lower mortgage rates, more roommates, and AI-powered house hunting: 6 things that will shape the housing market next year
description: The housing market is headed for a reset in 2026, with mortgage rates easing, price growth cooling, and more buyers entering the market, Redfin said.

title: From JPMorgan-branded beer foam to gym views, TikToks are revealing details of the bank's 270 Park headquarters
description: Videos on TikTok of what appear to be the building's interior show floor-to-ceiling windows, rows of cardio machines, and branded beer.

title: I tested 87 pairs of heels by walking a mile in each — these are the 21 most comfortable ones
description: I went on a long journey to find the impossible — heels that are comfortable, stylish, and so walkable that you can dance all night in them. Here's the ultimate list.

title: Michael Dell's journey to a $148 billion fortune began with a $1,000 investment
description: Dell founded his computer company in 1984 while a student at University of Texas. He had just $1,000 to start with.

title: Goldman Sachs says one of retail traders' favorite long-shot bets may be overhyped
description: Everyday investors have been big fans of flying car stocks, but Goldman Sachs says the most popular names look like risky bets.

title: OpenAI is feeling the heat from Google right now — for good reason
description: The tale of two "code red" alerts, three years apart, highlights that even a buzzy AI pioneer like OpenAI can face competitive pressures.

title: The labor market feels so awful right now because companies are doing everything bar announcing mass layoffs, says the Fed
description: Why job seekers feel the slowdown: Beige Book shows “low-hire, low-fire” trends, AI limiting new roles, before a 2026 rebound.

title: Vanguard has a change of heart on crypto, lists Bitcoin and other ETFs
description: The brokerage firm, long averse to crypto, will let traders buy and sell blockchain-wrapped funds.

title: CEO of $5.6 billion Swiss bank says country is still the ‘No. 1 location’ for wealth after voters reject a tax on the ultrarich
description: In Switzerland, the top 300 wealthiest residents are worth over $1 trillion. And one banking boss says he remains “bullish” about it remaining a top destination for the world’s wealthiest.

title: A Supreme Court decision could put your internet access at risk. Here’s who could be affected
description: SCOTUS heard oral arguments in a case that could decide if internet service providers are liable for digital theft perpetrated by their customers.

title: Why time is becoming the new currency of giving
description: Your children are watching. They will remember not just what you said about kindness, but how you practiced it.

title: IBM exec asks job candidates whether they think we are in an AI bubble as a make-or-break interview test
description: Do you think we’re in an AI Bubble? Even the experts can’t agree. And weirdly, your opinion on all this could decide whether you get the job.

title: How Anthropic’s safety first approach won over big business—and how its own engineers are using its Claude AI
description: Anthropic engineers mostly use Claude for debugging, not writing new software, but they worry about deskilling

title: China’s ByteDance could be forced to sell TikTok U.S., but its quiet lead in AI will help it survive—and maybe even thrive
description: ByteDance, the owner of TikTok and target of Washington ire, operates China’s most popular chatbot, Doubao.

title: Exclusive: Billionaire Michele Kang launches $25 million U.S. Soccer institute that promises to transform the future of women’s sports
description: Women are not just “small men”—and Kang’s efforts will target everything from treating women’s injuries to preventing girls from dropping out of youth sports.

title: Harvard MBA grads are landing jobs paying $184K—but a record number are still ditching the corporate world and choosing entrepreneurship instead
description: Harvard MBAs are cashing in with record-high salaries, but they’re also snubbing the corporate world at a record rate. As AI reshapes the workforce, they’d rather bet on jobs in tech—or on themselves as founders.

title: Elden Ring: Nightreign The Forsaken Hollows Is "Definitely" Harder, But "Not Ridiculous"
description:
Elden Ring: Nightreign's The Forsaken Hollows expansion launches on December 4, and fans should prepare themselves for a challenge--but nothing too extreme. Elden Ring and Nightreign are known for being challenging endeavors, and that will continue with The Forsaken Hollows.
Game director Junya Ishizaki told GameSpot that From Software didn't want the expansion to be "so hard that new players can't get into it." However, people should not expect to breeze through it.
"[The Forsaken Hollows is] definitely a little bit harder, but it's not ridiculous or anything like that, but that's still within what we would consider to be a fair challenge," the developer said.

title: Ball X Pit Hits 1 Million Copies Sold And Will Roll Out Three Free Updates Next Year
description:
Devolver Digital wants to talk about balls. For starters, Ball X Pit just reached a new sales milestone, selling 1 million copies. But that's not all: Developer Kenny Sun is working on brand-new balls for the action-roguelite game, with three free updates on the way next year.
The first new content planned for Ball X Pit is set to release in January with the Regal Update. The Shadow Update is scheduled to follow in April, with the Naturalist Update on the way in July.

title: Fallout 76 Burning Springs Update Adds New Map Region And Walton Goggins' The Ghoul
description: Fallout 76's Burning Springs update is live, bringing the game's largest map expansion yet. The patch notes for Burning Springs also highlight new Bounty features, more wildlife, and the introduction of The Ghoul character from Amazon Prime Video's Fallout TV series.

title: Judas Creator Sheds New Light On The Game's Main Character And Setting
description:
Ken Levine's Judas has been in development for a very long time, and it will be his first major project since BioShock Infinite's Burial At Sea DLC in 2014. A few of the gameplay elements we've seen from Judas greatly resemble BioShock's interface. But according to Levine, his team doesn't think of it as a first-person shooter. Instead, he called it a "Judas simulator," since the main character's name is Judas.
"Judas ...

title: Marathon Stolen Art Issue Has Been Resolved
description:
Bungie's Marathon was reported to have used stolen art, but the matter has now apparently been resolved. The artist who originally brought the claims against Bungie has now announced that the issue "has been resolved with Bungie and Sony Interactive Entertainment to my satisfaction."
No further details were divulged regarding the nature of the matter and how this closure came to be. People are theorizing that the artist received a settlement payment, but that is not confirmed.

title: Avowed's Fall Update Has Been Pushed To 2026, Will Now Include More Content
description:
Obsidian has announced that the planned fall update for Avowed is not going to make it on time. The features planned for the update are still coming, but they are now going to be wrapped into a "larger update" instead in February 2026 to celebrate the game's first anniversary.
"This update will include everything originally planned for fall, plus additional features that will make it our biggest update yet. Stay tuned as we head into the new year for more details on what’s planned for the Living Lands," the developer said.
Avowed previously got spring and summer updates that added things like a no-spiders mode and custom map markers.

title: Red Dead Redemption's New Version Launched With A Big Issue On Xbox
description:
Rockstar Games launched the new version of Red Dead Redemption on modern consoles and mobile today, December 2, but the rollout did not go entirely smoothly on Xbox.
People who already own Red Dead Redemption for Xbox 360 digitally were expecting the new edition for Xbox Series X|S to automatically show up as a free download, but quickly noticed this didn't happen.
This is an issue that Rockstar is aware of and the studio is working with Microsoft to resolve it. "Thank you for your patience," Rockstar said.
Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A Players Can Now Get Mewtwo
description:
The Pokemon Company is giving away another freebie for Pokemon Legends: Z-A. Players can now claim two free Mega Stones for Mewtwo, which will unlock a side quest to catch the legendary Pokemon.
The two Mega Stones--Mewtwonite X and Mewtwonite Y--can be downloaded via the Mystery Gift function. Once equipped, they allow the legendary Pokemon to Mega Evolve into Mega Mewtwo X and Mega Mewtwo Y, respectively.

title: CoD Season 1 Battle Pass Adds New Guns, Operators, And Faster Unlocks In BO7 And Warzone
description:
Call of Duty Season 1 arrives in Black Ops 7 and Warzone on December 4, and Activision has revealed a detailed look at the contents of the brand-new battle pass. Season 1's battle pass includes over a hundred items to earn across free and premium tiers. This content includes two more guns, a new operator, and plenty of cosmetic items to earn. Season 1 also changes how players unlock items in the battle pass to make it more rewarding.
Purchasing the standard ($10) battle pass for Season 1 includes an instant operator unlock for Dorne, who is the season's newest operator for the Guild faction.

title: How To Start Elden Ring Nightreign DLC - The Forsaken Hollows
description:
Elden Ring Nightreign packs a solid number of nightfarers and bosses in its base game, ensuring players have plenty to do right out of the gate. But if you've seen everything in the initial release and want some fresh challenges, The Forsaken Hollows DLC adds two new playable characters, two extra bosses, and a fresh Shifting Earth event. If you're curious what you'll need to accomplish to unlock access to these additions, though, we've got you covered below.
How to start The Forsaken Hollows DLC in Elden Ring Nightreign
Before you can begin unlocking the content in The Forsaken Hollows DLC, you'll need to purchase and download it from your platform's respective storefront. Alternatively, if you've previously purchased the Elden Ring Nightreign Deluxe Edition, you'll be able to download the DLC at no additional cost.
